channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2023120774
item.description:
Report X-2023120774

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS NOTICED TO BE WET. THE PROGRESS OF THE PACKAGE WAS STOPPED AND A RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED. THE RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE RESPONSE SHEET. THE PACKAGE WAS TAKEN BACK TO THE DMP AREA AND PROCESSED ACCORDINGLY.

item.title: Report X-2023120764
item.description:
Report X-2023120764

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: MAUMEE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WENT TO RETRIEVE THE PACKAGE AND OBSERVED THAT IT WAS AN OXIDIZER, CORROSIVE HAZMAT. RESPONDER PROCEDED BY FIRST TESTING THE LIQUID WITH PH TAPE WHICH RESAULTED IN A READING OF 1. FROM THERE THEY NEUTRALIZED THE SPILL WITH SODIUM BICARBONATE UNTIL A NEUTRIAL READING WAS ACHIEVED. THEY ABSORBED THE SPILL WITH ZEP ABSORBANT. THEY BROUGHT THE BOX BACK TO THE DEPARTMENT TO BE PROCESSED THROUGH DMP

Report X-2023120775

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL LEAKER, PUT ON PPE AND TOOK ALL SUPPLIES TO SPILL, READ DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER READ WASTE DISPOSAL AND DECONTAMINATION, CLEANED UP SPILL AND TOOK BACK TO DMP AREA. RESPONDER PROCESSED AND CLEANED UP.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler on the offline belt sat the box on a pallet at door 220 and a few minutes later a huge puddle appeared. DescribePack: small puncture hole on bottom corner of bottle DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: It was picked up and placed in a leaker tote with gloves

item.title: Report X-2023120592
item.description:
Report X-2023120592

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: MAUMEE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR OF LEAKING PACKAGE. SUPERVISOR CALLED IT OUT ON THE RADIO. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ALONG WITH THE RMP RESPONDED TO PD 11 DOOR 151 GRATES AND FOUND THE LEAKING PACKAGE. AFTER SEEING WHAT THE PACKAGE WAS AND TYPE OF HAZMAT, IT WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TRY WITH ZEP ABSORBENT. ZEP ABSORBENT WAS THEN USED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL THAT WAS ON THE FLOOR UNDER THE GRATES. THE GRATES WERE NOT LEAKED ON. THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO PSC AREA TO BE PROCESSED. CHROMEX BINDER A WAS THE LEAKING BOTTLE. THE LID WAS FOUND TO BE OFF WITH NO SEAL. THIS WAS ABSORBED USING ZEP ABSORBANT. CHROMEX BINDER B WAS FIRST NEUTROLIZED USING SODIUM BICARB, THEN WAS ABSORBED USING ZEP ABSORBENT. BOTH DESIGNATED RESPONDER AND RMP WORE THE CORRECT PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT.

item.description:

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Notified by Manager of leaking hazardous material box at door 28. Inspected and put leaking box into hazmat bag inside of a solid plastic FedEx plastic bin (tub). Cleaned area by rollers with absorbent cloths. DescribePack: Cap came loose during transport and contents leaked out into box DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Put into hazmat bag then into plastic FedEx tote (bin). Cleaned area with absorbent cloths.

item.title: Report E-2023120456
item.description:
Report E-2023120456

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the offloading process, a 55-Gallon metal drum containing Low Gloss Black Primer (UN1263) was punctured by a forklift and released its entire contents onto the trailer floor and the asphalt below. A contractor cleaned the release with the use of Oil Dry. The damaged drum was overpacked for waste disposal along with the spent absorbents. No storm drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this release.

item.title: Report E-2023120405
item.description:
Report E-2023120405

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 13, 2023, one (1) 20-gallon drum of UN3266 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, cleaners, and absorbents to remediate the site. Crews patched the damaged 20-gallon drum of product and placed it into a 35-gallon drum. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum. Both containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: INSUFFICIENT INNER PACKING ALLOWED GLASS BOTTLE TO BECOME BROKEN AND COMPLETE LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET BOX AND BROKEN WERE PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2023120406
item.description:
Report E-2023120406

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 14, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote containing UN1805 had a loose cap during transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE deployed a neutralizer to the tote and the trailer floor. The crew utilized a fork lift to elevate the impacted tote and gravity transfer the material into a new tote. FCE deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer. The crew utilized hand tools to collect the neutralizer and absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023120404
item.description:
Report E-2023120404

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 13, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1760 was crushed in transit and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel successfully transferred the contents from the damaged 330-gallon tote to a new 330-gallon tote for further shipment and processing. Crews utilized hand tools to cut up the damaged tote for waste, and they utilized a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads to remediate the impacted dock floor. Four (4) 55-gallon drums containing the cut-up tote, spent absorbent pads, damaged metal fittings, and impacted cardboard were generated as waste and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.
